transcript: Albanese: Thanks very much. Uh, to put really clearly, uh, there were tax cuts legislated under the former government. They went primarily. I would have got $9,000, so would Peter. Instead, we got four and a half, and we gave it to everyone. By lowering that bottom marginal tax rate. Now what we've done is we'll lower it by a cent, and then a further cent, uh, over the next, uh, over the next term of government. Because we wanted to make sure that every Australian got a tax cut, and the way that you make sure that low and middle income earners benefit is to target that first marginal tax rate that kicks in, of course at $18,200 and goes up to $45,000.
Moderator: Let's wrap up if we can. We're going to get them final statements in a moment, just a couple of quick answers if I can
segment_summary: Albanese responds to a question on cost of living and tax cuts. He explains that his government lowered the bottom marginal tax rate to ensure every Australian got a tax cut, benefiting low and middle-income earners. The Moderator then announces it is time for closing statements.

key_arguments.argument: The government's tax cuts benefit all Australians by lowering the bottom marginal tax rate.
High income earners would have gotten $9000 in the prior government's scheme.

rhetorical_analysis.communication_style_notes: Albanese explains the tax cuts and frames them as benefitting all of Australia as opposed to high income earners as the prior government did.

perspective_commentary.conservative: Albanese is trying to defend the current government's plan by arguing a previous scheme helped high income earners. There is the risk that high income earners are negatively impacted by this change.
perspective_commentary.neutral: Albanese explains the intent behind providing a tax cut to all Australians and not the higher earners. It would be helpful to know if low income earners benefit more from this tax policy.
perspective_commentary.progressive: Giving money to everyone seems like a fair idea and there is a good point to make sure people feel supported. High income earners are going to be alright regardless.

connections_to_previous_segments: This builds on to all of the previous conversations with housing and costs.
interaction_dynamics: Albanese responds to the audience question.

notable_quotes.quote: The way that you make sure that low and middle income earners benefit is to target that first marginal tax rate
notable_quotes.speaker: Albanese

segment_concise_summary: Albanese defends the Labor tax cuts, stating that it's to benefit people.
